definition: right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: No one is to return through the gate by which he entered, but each is to go out the opposite gate.
sentences.chinese: 不可從所入的門而出，必要直往前行，由對門而出。

sentences.english: Maybe it's the door to door stranger.
sentences.chinese: 也許是門對門的陌生人。

sentences.english: My assistant's office is across the hall from mine.
sentences.chinese: 我助手的辦公室和我的是對門。

definition: the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
the first stick of incense placed in the censer (believed to bring good luck esp. during festivities)/(slang) (Tw) the first reply to a blog post etc
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
kiosk/snack counter/retail department or section inside a larger business
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
